CatDescriptText: Ethel Sales, domestic, 7329 Schley Street, Penn Hills, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 30, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think single or married women make better teachers for elementary grades in public schools?  Do you think that married men should teach in elementary grades?" answer reads: "It depends upon the individual and this varies.  In some cases, the single woman makes the better teacher, while in others it is the married woman who is the best.  Regardless of whether the teacher is married or not the success depends on whether or not she likes the job."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ethel Sales wearing a plaid dress, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Bud Saunders Flowers,  Liberty Avenue, Downtown
